title: Valance, 18th century
description: Valance of white linen patterned by open weaving also known as "red de telar" or "red de Val de Verdja." Design shows a central female figure holding candles and flanked on either side by large-scale stylized vase form with flowers. In the interstices are small-scale female figures and animals. Heavy fringe on the bottom and band of plain linen at top.

tombstone.epitaph:
Valance, 18th century.Medium: linen
Technique: eccentric weft. 1943-52-2.
